metadata.title: CVE-2023-39197 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in Netfilter ConnectionTracking (conntrack) in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a remote user todisclose sensitive information via the DCCP protocol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1129.135
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-252.286~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.135').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
